Cititel Mid Valley Hotel
7.5 Very good
Based on 14617 reviews

Stayed in Cititel Mid Valley about 8 years ago. This trip has the same feeling as last time. but I noticed the place is in need of a renovation.

Wall paper is pealing off, and toilet feels a little darker, etc... Friendly and helpful staff is always available. In my annual trips to Malaysia, I have been staying at the Boulevard, which is the opposite end of the mid valley shopping center. A little more high class than Cititel, but obviously, more expensive. $120 vs $80. Have same access to great shopping facilities, good food stales around, and pretty central and not a long distance to other major shopping areas. Only downside is taxi may be hard to find if you want to go out late at night. It's a good idea to grab the number of a good Blue Taxi driver who works around the area, or use UBER / Grab to catch a ride

Show more
Joseph , Australia
The Gardens - A St Giles Signature Hotel & Residences Kuala Lumpur
8.3 Excellent
Based on 7266 reviews

Was checked into 2 bedroom deluxe earlier upon request for 3 nights stay on 20 July, however, room was not satisfactory because rusty water came out from tap for both rooms and no dressing mirror in master bedroom, bedsheets were stained.

Upon our request to change room the next day, the Assistant Housekeeping Manager(from Hotel side,sorry can't remember her name) came over to check and arranged for the change. They prepared a surprise for us, decorated the changed room with balloons! What a warm welcome! The changed room was clean, comfortable and staff attitude was excellent. Nuri, Zalina and Naomi of (Housekeeping) keep it up! Sorry to the AMgr from Hotel side, cannot remember her name. She is also to be commended for her efficiency. Mrs Yeo

Show more
HL , Singapore
One World Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 5268 reviews

We booked for family suite (2 rooms, one is very big and luxury, the other is standard room, connected together by doors) Many surprises when staying in the hotel, gifts (fruits and traditional candies for mine), air purifier (big room), USB charger, very very good sofas, bath tub and etc.

Smart TV provide many functions like services in hotel, promotion and of course TV channel and movies (extra money) EXCELLENT WiFi Connection! (limited 4 devices per room) Just beside the 1 Utama shopping complex, but need to remember the way back to hotel. The 1 Utama app can't found the way back to hotel and there's almost no directory inside the mall. Breakfast is very good, add RM 48 for extra person, remember not to go too late or many food will be gone, they start cleaning right on 10:30 am, so no much food after 10 am.

Show more
NEO , Malaysia
Traders Hotel by Shangri-La
8.9 Excellent
Based on 9322 reviews

The 1st thing that caught our eye as we entered the room was the majestic view of the twin towers right in front of our eyes! Seemed close enough to touch.

Generally pleased with front desk staff who were able to see to my requests. Tracy checked us in when we came slightly early around 12+pm. With our room nt ready til 2pm, we waited at the lobby couches w our baby. We were surprised when Tracy came to us few minutes later informing that another room is ready for us and decided to alocate it to us since we had a baby w us. We were quite certain she forgot about us since more guests were beginning to crowd the front desk. Nice touch Tracy! Room was nice and shower facilities n water pressure was superb! Everything was working well except for small thing like the kettle. Tv channels were reasonably clear. Room and the AC felt clean enough. Improvement could be made to the babycot we requested. I found old biscuit crumbs under the mattress. And the cot was not working properly even after i requested for another one. The base could not be adjusted to higher height due to faulty or missing parts. Eventually ended up not using it. You should be aware that hygiene is priority for babies. And a lower base means having to bend down more to pick up the baby. Expected much better in this aspect. Overall would still recommend this place and room to others and would come back again! Thank you.

Show more
Benny , Singapore
Furama Hotel Bukit Bintang
7.8 Very good
Based on 17051 reviews

We booked 3 rooms with the hotel, and I must say that Furama Bukit Bintang on the whole didn't live up to our expectations.

I will start with the better experiences. The cleanliness of the hotel wasn't too bad apart from the fact that for some reason they do not change the bath mats on a daily basis. As for the location, it was average if you have help from Uber or Grab. However, the offerings within the hotel area was pretty scarce so you would have to travel out of the area so find something decent. Moving on to the less favourable experiences, first of all check in was a huge mess. We got to the hotel at about 12pm and was told that we could check in. However, after the standard check in procedures, we were told that the rooms weren't ready and would have to return at 2pm which is about the standard check in time which was understandable. Thus, we went out to grab some lunch and even roamed the streets till about 3pm which is more than enough ample time. To our dismay, upon returning to the hotel, the receptionist then mentioned we would need to wait another 10 minutes before we could proceed to our rooms. After waiting out the 10 minutes, we could finally head to our rooms and were further dissatisfied as the beds were actually 2 single beds which were combined which wasn't very friendly and we subsequently requested for a paid upgrade of 150RM to their Executive Suite category which then wasted more time. All in all, it was about 5pm when we finally got settled into our respective rooms. Secondly, the in-room service in terms of requesting for a clean bath mat or laundry bags took ages. I had to personally call a second time and the total wait time amounted to approximately half an hour before it was finally sent up which was absolutely ridiculous. All in all, these amounted to a below average stay and I definitely won't recommend it to anyone else. One may in turn look to try the Novotel or even WOLO as a better option in terms of value.

Show more
Ian , Singapore
Concorde Hotel Kuala Lumpur
8.2 Excellent
Based on 7794 reviews

Booked few hours before check in. 1. From hotel car park quite a distance to walk to lobby as in another building with a linked walkway but carrying heavy luggage walking the staircase up and down.

.hhmmm...noticed there have Valet parking lot at the basement of hotel building. 2. Upon arrival at lobby, the front desk was congested with heavy load evening check-in. ( around 3 counters), a lady receptionist who just walked out from front office alerted and very attentive by immediately open another check in counter at my line. Firstly, she unable to find my booking provided name with I.D card, according to her reservation was closed on that day. Anyhow, i gave her the Agoda confirmation email of booking number and room details. Without further delay, she check me in and brief the rest of info as the routine procedure. (wifi login, breakfast...etc) when got into the room, later only found out that my room was upgraded from Superior to Deluxe.3. Room - Clean and quiet room with the basic facilities that meet 4-star standard plus ironing facilities and cd/dvd player. Comfort bed, good selection of international tv channel. WiFi connection a bit slow at night (barely connect) but speedy in the morning. No bathtub but shower with good water pressure, no water hose attached next to toilet bowl may be old structure of hotel building. Food - Good varieties of buffet dinner, A la carte for Combo set RM38nett not bad too, portion served just nice for a person. but was recommended the Chinese restaurant food not bad. Buffet breakfast meet the basic 3~4 star standard for Asean not Asian countries coz no Japanese or Korean in buffet line. Bakery choices are fair enough for the Western but not the cheeses and no dessert (mini tart or petit) so the finishing normally will be the fruits. Location - easy access to KLCC, Pavilion. Nearest place to chill out - Hard Rock Cafe just next to hotel. Overall a pleasant stay in Concorde Kuala Lumpur, recommended for business or leisure in KL

Show more
Chong , Malaysia
Shangri-La Hotel Kuala Lumpur
8.9 Excellent
Based on 3799 reviews

This was our first trip to Kuala Lumpur, but our second stay in a Shangri-La hotel. The accommodations and staff were wonderful, and the location was perfect, right between the KL Tower and the Petronas Towers, with plenty of places to eat and drink and shop in between.

Also a short walk to a monorail station which was also very convenient for getting around. I can't say enough good things about Shangri-La hotels, we will intend to try and stay with them whenever we travel.

Show more
David , United States
The Majestic Hotel Kuala Lumpur, Autograph Collection
8.9 Excellent
Based on 2636 reviews

i asked concierge for a recommendation for hari raya. he gives me the best idea ever: to visit the sultan, as the place was open to the public for a day; best day ever.

now - back to the hotel, where i only ever stay when in KL, for this reason: no other hotel has ever demonstrated such a willingness to provide every comfort - way above expectations. the detail in everything is flawless. the staff, all unbelievably friendly and giving. the surroundings, elegant and homely. you always feel at home at the majestic. i miss the premier suite the minute i step out; i feel welcomed the second i arrive at the door. personable, attentive and inclusive. the smiles from staff are genuine and perpetual. stars aside, the majestic promises more than luxury - it guarantees peace of mind and comfort; more than you will find almost anywhere. it's my first choice for KL and i most certainly recommend this hotel to you should you ever contemplate spending your time in this wonderful city! book it now!

Show more
carlos , Australia
Dorsett Kuala Lumpur
7.9 Very good
Based on 4837 reviews

Pros: Location is good, situated behind Starhill Gallery which is opposite Pavilion and en route to Bukit Bintang area.

About 10-15 minutes walk to Sungei Wang and Times Square from hotel. Room is big, good for 3 people. Cons: Booked a family room but was noisy given that it was behind the lift, thus we could hear the "roller coaster-like" sounds whenever the lifts were activated. Asked for a change of room but they could only offer their normal room with additional bed. The 2 staff whom we requested for a change need more training - one of them reacted like he had expected the noise while the other lady said there were available rooms but told us to go back at 2pm. Both of them did not sound apologetic at all and I was disappointed by her attitude. However, we happen to bump into Mr Gavin (unsure of his designation) in the lift and he through our casual chat, when he heard about our experience, he apologised. Same for Ms Joy who was at the counter when we checked out. Had intended to rate their service very lowly but cos of them, I left with a better impression. Don't expect doormen to open the door for you too. For those driving, basement carpark ramp is VERY narrow so watch out when you drive in and out of the carpark. Tip: For those who are lightsleepers and travelling in 3s, better to book deluxe room and add additional bed. For the staff, perhaps they could have warned us about the noise upon check-in as I had requested for quiet room.

Show more
Joanna , Singapore
Grand Millennium Kuala Lumpur Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 4774 reviews

The toilet sink was not cleaned properly, as there were red substance found around the sink area and below the water tap where it seemed like blood stain which is super unhygienic there were like bubble gum stain on the wall and even the bed sheet was not clean as there were stains on them.

Requested for a change of room was given an even older room where the carpets are so terribly dirty where there are stains all over and even red ink which makes me comfortable, requested to change to a newer room was given a much cleaner and newer room but the bed sheet was again with blue ink stain and dark stain on my fren's bed , its terrible and you could find a cheaper and cleaner place nearby, however the staff was pretty helpful and accommodating

Show more
Chiang , Malaysia
The Boulevard - A St Giles Hotel Kuala Lumpur
7.9 Very good
Based on 6010 reviews

It was my second visit to stay at Studio. My thumbs up for praising one of your male staff, Mr Vasu at Executive Lounge whereby we went in for breakfast.

He was indeed cheerful, helpful and warm person. I was having a very bad cough with thick phlegm whilst in S'pore. Upon seeing my condition, he suggested that he will offer me warm lemon honey water. I stayed there for four days and three nights with my sister. Last day when my sister went down earlier for breakfast. Your kind staff, Mr Vasu was asking my sister how is my cough. Later I went down and was impressed of his memory of remembering our names. My last day he offered me warm honey lemon water. Sad to say that breakfast at 9th floor was no standard. I preferred to go up to Executive lounge and served by your smiling, courteous staff, Mr Vasu. I salute his caring and mannerism. It was indeed a warm environment and caring staff and I would indeed certainly recommend my friend, business associates & etc

Show more
Lum , Singapore
Hilton Kuala Lumpur Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2559 reviews

Its Hilton! I have stayed in Hilton branded hotels in some other countries and I can say the rooms and services are immaculate.

I can really rely on their performance that my room won't be disappointing and it shall be up to what I would hope to get - all the time! KL Hilton has one of the nicest rooms in terms of layout, decoration and facility. The room sizes are generally big with exceptions of maybe a few on the middle floors (I think). I stayed here a number of times since January 2017 and got to experience different types of rooms and views. The room layout provides you a great sense of privacy with a "hallway" style entrance the sleeping area. The sleeping area comes complete with a movable study/dining table that you can move about and I always moved it close to the window for view and light. There is also a chaise-lounge by the window with plush pillows that you can laze in for a nice afternoon nap. The bed is also comfortable. the pillow that provide for you is seldom great but you can call "magic" for a change of pillow to suit your requirements. The shower and toilet and area is one of THE most generous and luxurious that I have come to experience in a hotel. The star of this area would be the deep and long, white marble clad bath tub! Superb! I love staying in this particular Hilton hotel and to date is my favorite among the other Hilton hotels!

Show more
Mohd , Malaysia
Tune Hotel klia2
7.5 Very good
Based on 8427 reviews

The checking in takes far far far too long, especially on the day of my arrival at about 1045pm. The queue was long.

Priority counter for customer who has confirmed and paid bookings should be provided to eliminate the pain at check for those who bothered to pre-book rooms. Some of the walk in guests have to discuss with the hotel staff asking lots of questions, delaying customers who have confirmed reservation. This is the only worse low of this hotel. Take my suggestions and fix this up and don't let complacency from good occupancy ruin this.

Show more
Lenny , Malaysia
PARKROYAL Kuala Lumpur
8.2 Excellent
Based on 6587 reviews

Stayed over for a night with my family. If you want a simple clean room that comes with a very strategic location with a spread for breakfast, this will be good for your choice.

Not advisable if you are paying for the services; nothing felt like a five-star service level. 1. Front desk: these are the first person to face hotel clients yet they barely made the cut in making the best impression with their conversational skills and they generally lack in attentiveness. Went to lower end and boutique hotels that have friendlier and better front desk services. From my personal experience; we, unfortunately, had to make a very late check in on a Saturday night so I may have caused inconveniences to the front desk POC. For some reason, it took longer than usual for the person to get the booking sorted out so when we casually asked "hey may i know why is this taking quite a while?", the receptionist curtly replied "I just came over to the front desk" and continued working. 2. Breakfast: the spread is somewhat decent; the first reason why I chose this place is primarily because I have read many positive reviews on this online. I have bigger issues with how they were managing the crowd and the level of attentiveness they have as a five-star establishment. I'm not sure if this was due to a major under-staff situation or the crowd management system just weren't efficient enough to handle the massive family crowds, but there was quite a hold-up with a queue and the receptionists seemed to be ticking off a messy sheet to count for attendance and gave a lukewarm response that doesn't give us any confirmation when asked whether we are ready to be seated. When asked again, the receptionist simply just gave us a look until we heard someone from afar calling us which then motioned us with a hand gesture to usher us to a table that they have just managed to clean. They should also start providing chairs for those in need (parents with kids, elderlies, pregnant ladies) at the counter

Show more
Sue , Malaysia
Berjaya Times Square Hotel, Kuala Lumpur
7.9 Very good
Based on 6158 reviews

I have stayed at this hotel at least 5 different times and the only reason is the location is ideal and the easy access to the mall, Check in and check out is like been police interrogated they treat guests like enemies and do nothing to make the check in process welcoming or efficient, After a long flight and even longer taxi from the airport the last thing anyone wants is a moody arrogant check in staff treating me like I don't belong there.

Check out was same procedure and it drives me insane that check in can take so long while the staff whisper to each other about guests and then pretend to be actively dealing with my booking. My recent experience has left a very sour taste in my mouth and made me question why I waste my money when there are thousands of other hotels in the vicinity who would treat guests as they should be treated. Your front desk staff are the first people guests deal with and should be made to feel welcome. Your hotel is listed as 5 stars but the service is more like a budget guest house. The rooms are dated and in dire need of a clean and modernisation. Not sure it's worth complaining because I'm sure your management don't care anyways.

Show more
Jamie , South Africa
Sunway Putra Hotel Kuala Lumpur
8.2 Excellent
Based on 7933 reviews

I was offered to upgrade my room to club room with an additional cost of RM58 per person per night. (my booking with Agoda did not include breakfast).

The privileges given were excellent for example breakfast and cocktail and all day snacks at level 34 as well as you can check out at 4 pm (subject to availability). However, i was quite disappointed with room amenities (in the fridge especially). I was told by the reception that all amenities and everything in the mini fridge was FOC and the housekeeping will top up once finished. Surprisingly it only has 3 can drinks and tea/coffee sachets. For improvement and customer satisfactory value for money maybe you may offer extra amenities like chocolate, junks food, small cakes and etc which after all its club room! the bathroom was clogged, slow drain and if you open shower on high volume it caused a flood in the bathroom/toilet. The club room deco & ambiance is so dull and i am more prefer deluxe room with blue carpet, very nice and modern sofa as well as wide window. TQ.

Show more
Noorshamriza , Malaysia
Sunway Resort Hotel & Spa
8.4 Excellent
Based on 3903 reviews

First thought I have when we checked in to our room, is that it's very old. And room is very small. We had been upgraded from premium park view room to a club room (also park view), as there is a mandatory power shut down on the day we checked in (Malaysia Boleh!).

So all guests were arranged to stay one night at the Hotel Pyramid next door (without having to move our luggage). But the moving here and there actually affects our sleep and made us more tired than we should be. The hotel kinda made this up by upgrading us to a Club room (without the use of the club lounge). But except the room is on a higher floor, really can't tell what's so special about the Club room. It's small. If fits 2 super single beds, and some basic furniture and that's all the space it has. Nothing to shout about and I would have preferred to continue to stay at the Hotel Pyramid (not given the option also) since it's just newly refurbished, at least the bed and toilet are new. Not only the furniture in the room is old, the facilities are also old, like the swimming pool. It's strange that swimming pool is almost always empty for the 3 days we were there. The quietest swimming pool we have seen so far. Could it be that there is the Sunway Lagoon next door or the pool is not attractive? The staff are worth giving 2 thumbs up. Service is good throughout - bell service, front door, front desk and breakfast buffet service staff. Buffet breakfast is good, with a wide variety of food and all look and taste pretty decent. Out of the 3 hotels, this is the most expensive hotels. But I felt it's really not worth the money. If you have to choose one, choose the other 2 which have been just gone through a major renovation recently. All 3 have easy access to the Sumway Pyramid shopping centre and Sunway Lagoon.

Show more
Yau , Malaysia
Hotel Istana Kuala Lumpur City Center
8.2 Excellent
Based on 5838 reviews

The lobby, concierge and reception staff are welcoming and efficient. Be aware that the lobby and restaurant can be uncomfortably chilly, which can be a shock when you come in hot from outside.

It is a beautiful entrance space with fresh flower displays! Makes you feel special. The beds are comfortable, but the room and bathroom are in need of refurbishment. There were a few stains on the towels and sheets just because they were old rather than dirty. The bathroom is a fabulous size with a double sink that my friend and I loved. Sadly, the floor had painted tiles which were now scuffed and stained and the shower room had some mould growth. Based on 292 reviews

Best hostel I've ever stayed in! We came in a big group of 52 persons, booked 52 beds, coming to KL at the end of our study trip.

We arrived in KL early in the morning by bus from Singapore. The bus stop at Berjaya Times Square is just about 5 min walking from the hostel. Perfect! Revopackers was very kind to accept us for an early check in, VERY EARLY in the morning. Though not the whole 52 beds were available at that time, we were so grateful to have a place for a quick rest after a long bus trip. All the staff were very friendly. Ask them anything, and they will give you the informations and help you. Andrea one of them were exceptionally helpful. She helped us to arrange a last minute bus tour, also our bus to the airport. Nearby the hostel there are places for food, halal and non halal. both is just around the corner, with affordable prices. I definitely recommend this hostel.

Le Village China Town
6.2 Good
Based on 413 reviews

Le Village is a wonderful place for budget travelers. Its cheap, you get good service and you are staying in an amazing location (for sightseeing, culture, food and nightlife).

I love the easy going atmosphere! You really feel that Locky (who is running this place) likes to help his guests and takes care of them. I arrived late but even though he was so welcoming and gave me many interesting information about Kuala Lumpur and the area around it. The rooms are basic and nice. You can get towels and a blanket if you ask (and you get your laundry done for a short money). There is a cosy communal living room with chilled music tunes (and a computer you can use). They have book exchange and couple of games as well. You get free drinking water, coffee/tea and you can use the fridge. My favourite spot in this guesthouse is the huge rooftop with its many plants and the rooftopkitchen. The view over the heart of chinatown is authem (and the sunset can be too)! I met so many amazing people and had great talks here. Thank you very much for your hospitality!

I booked this hotel for a weekend getaway with best friends. We were looking for a simple place to sleep within the KL Sentral area and we chose The Bodhi Lodge based on the good reviews.

A few days before our arrival, Gigi (the owner, I guess?) emailed me the map and directions to get to The Bodhi Lodge which turned out to be really helpful. It's located around 8 minutes walk from Bangsar LRT station. It was a bit confusing to find the place at first but then I used Google map and found it quite easily. Me and my friends booked the quad room and we were placed in their new building, just behind their first building. The place was really clean and not noisy at all although we were really close to the main road of Bangsar. They provided water dispenser, fridge, and hair dryer in the common area. Two shared bathrooms, one of them was a bit too small for a bathroom I guess. The quad room was ok. We had two bunkbeds which made quite a lot of sounds when someone moves. The air conditioner was a bit hot. They provided lockers in the room, an electric socket for each bed and also a pillow and blanket. All in all, we were satisfied with the price we paid. The location was great, especially when you want to travel with public transportation or need to go to the airport in the morning from KL Sentral. Facilities were ok, sufficient for basic needs. I think this place is suitable for young couples or groups who just need a place to sleep at night. Not really recommend it for family with young children or old parents. Will definitely come back for a short stay with friends.

Phillip , Australia
Orange Pekoe Guesthouse
8.1 Excellent
Based on 361 reviews

My girlfriend and I stayed at Orange Pekoe for 2 nights. The room was spacious and sparsely but tastefully furnished.

The bathroom was quite small and simple and there was only 2 power sockets in the room, both used up with lamps (the room can be qui're dim without them), so there's some difficulty if you need to charge your phone/ iPad/ camera/ NB in the room. The staff was quite hospitable and friendly, and helps with getting an adapter in a pleasant manner. However, on the second night of our stay, we returned to a room without any electricity- no AC, no hot water, no lights, just the stuffing air of KL. The staff explained that there's been some sort of power out for the neighborhood, but all around us the power was on Except our building. When asked if we can have a flashlight to pack (we have an early flight next morning), the staff only shrugged, saying they have candles if we want. In the end we laid in the dark till 5, in a suffocating room with generators humming loudly outside the room. The next morning the staff offered no apology, no explanation, no nothing, as if the whole incident never occurred. It was extremely disappointing to be treated like this, feeling like simply because we're getting a room on the cheap, we can expect no hospitality or care when shit hit the fan. Overall not a bad room if you don't want to spend much, but you can do so much better for just a little more.

My stay with Rainforest Bed and Breakfast was irrevocably pleasant, up to a point that it relinquished my initial intention to hop to another hostel; one night just wasn't enough.

When I first stepped into the premises, I was swept away by its interior and the decor that adorned the place. Dim lightings and wooden furnishings made up the cosy atmosphere. What accentuated the place even further was the smile and greeting from the staff (although, their lime green and sunshine yellow uniform were a stark contrast to the look of the place). I stayed in the three-bedded Male dormitory which consisted of three beds and a cupboard with three doors, each containing a safety deposit box. The room was small, making it a little squeezy. Otherwise, the mattresses, pillows and duvet were comfortable. For RM 40 (SGD 13) a night, this hostel is a definite value for money. The area is also well-situated, with nearby bars and food places. A 5 minute walk brings you to the heart of Bukit Bintang.

We chose this hotel because we wanted to stay in a neighborhood. To get to the hotel required a bus transfer from the metro and then a walk of about 2-3 blocks.

It was easy to do and once we were settled, we really enjoyed the surrounding area. The room was large, the beds and furniture were clean and comfortable. The air conditioning was great. There is a really well furnished common kitchen area where you can cook, store food in the refrigerator, etc. There are dishes and utensils and the common area is cheery and a nice place to meet with the other guests. There was a washing machine and we were able to clean our clothes and hang them up to dry over night for only about $3. The entrance to the guesthouse is very secure, with lock/card entrance to the stairway and then to the actual guest house. There was always someone at the front desk and always very helpful and friendly. The neighborhood has a variety of stalls for eating and having a cold beer in the evening. We enjoyed Chinese, Malay, and Indian foods for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I highly recommend this hotel and would return! It is friendly for families, couples, and single people. I give it 5 stars!!

Tinawati , Singapore
Summer Suites Bernice
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 303 reviews

Okay, admittedly, it took me 30 minutes to find the building, I guess it was partly my fault because I relied too much on Google Maps.

I typed "Summer Suites Bernice" and it pointed to me a different direction. The trick apparently is from Agoda (or any other booking website), you click "directions" and it will provide you a more accurate picture of the area. Also, better if you look for MERCU SUMMER SUITES which is the name of the building. Anyway, while I was a little bit pissed, the moment I met JAHA and saw how friendly he is and apologetic, the anger started to subside. And it evaporated completely when I saw the room!!! Imagine staying at the 28th floor of a condominium which is strategically located in an area that is very close to the city center. The view of course is amazing, I remember taking a peek at my room window and saw the KL tower! While you cannot see the Petronas Tower from the room (it is being blocked by another tall structure), it will take you less than 10 minutes by foot to the towers and the Kuala Lumpur City Center. Aside from the glorious view, Summer Suites Bernice has all the amenities - drinking water (both cold and hot and room temp), plates and mugs and utensils, fridge, even iron and hair dryer! Definitely an upgrade from the usual hostel! They maintain it very well so five stars as well for cleanliness. The dorm type also gives you an opportunity to meet and interact with people, as a solo traveler that is one major perk! Others might find it annoying to share a room with strangers, but I absolutely loved it - I even ended up hanging out with one of my room mates! The building is located in a safe area so I didn't mind going home at 2 or 4 in the morning after partying at Bukit Bintang. Haha. If ever I go back to KL, for sure I will stay again at Summer Suites Bernice - the best hostel in KL!

Did make a call when we reach and very quickly the staff come to look for us after 5 minutes. Was bringing us to the car park and also the apartment. Whole progress took only less than 15 minutes. Its consider fast and the room is clean + spacious. Deposit RM500 was given during check-in. However, they also very easily return us RM500 when we check-out. Did not check the apartment very detail. Just hand in the deposit to us. So, i think RM500 also not a big problem for us. Was walking to jalan alor around 3am to have the supper. Its very near and very happening. Very easily to get the apartment by driving through the SMART tunnel. We saw the Hang Tuah LRT while we are swimming on the level 5. Its should be a walking distance even though we did not take LRT. Highly recommend this apartment. This is our first stay and i believe we will be keep staying next time.

Placin @ Crown Regency KL
8.4 Excellent
Based on 111 reviews

Ok, I booked this as an Agoda mystery 4 star hotel, so my review will be a little coloured by the fact that this is a serviced apartment - even though it is in the Crown Regency Hotel.

The positives - it's large, airy and very convenient. You have access to the pool, a well-equipped gym and the other services offered by the Crown Regency. So, if you're purchasing as a serviced apartment (rather than a mystery hotel) these things are all great. The negatives: cleanliness! Ok, so the property was cleaned but the mattress in the main bedroom had multiple blood stains and yellow stains and no mattress protector - so the stains showed through the very thin sheets. The sheets themselves (while undoubtedly cleaned) had multiple ingrained stains all over them and were very poor quality. The main bathroom really stank and the master ensuite was not much better. We left exhaust fans on and sprayed deodoriser but the smell would not budge. The dryer and washing machine filters required cleaning (and servicing according to the dryer readout). You do not have access to the front reception facilities (you need to make a time to meet someone at the property for check in and chec out) and you are only provided with 1 key to your room. This means that for a group of three we had nowhere to leave a key and had to juggle times to 'meet up' so we could all get back into the room after our different travels for the day. Lastly, until I booked I was unaware I had to provide a 500MR CASH deposit on the property. I've got no issue with room deposits but would have expected this to be undertaken by a Credit Card hold - rather than leaving me with 500MR on the last morning of my journey. In summary, great location and size, good wifi, a good serviced apartment but NOT a four star hotel (as advertised by Agoda) and standards of cleanliness and linen were poor.

The apartment itself was great, it was 2 level and spacious. The washing machine was handy and it was great having a kitchenette.

The shower had good pressure and the temperature was great. It was clean and comfortable. The apartment complex is a little strange, it has a Tesco underneath it which is great, however there are a lot of empty retail spaces and there are a lot of bars, pubs. It did feel a little seedy in the evenings. It's a bit of a concrete jungle in there. Not a lot of soul. The process of 'self check-in' is a bit confusing. You have to find the right mailbox in building A and then you discover what apartment number you have, it may be in another block. So you then need to get to the other block. If you have a taxi/driver and lots of luggage make sure they wait for you to determine what block you are in. They may need to drive you further. It would be handy having more than one key (card), we were only given one. Also, the 500 MYR deposit was odd (it needed to be cash). All in all this place is great if you are travelling as a family and want to stay under the one roof. It's very affordable and convenient. The staff were very responsive and did provide detailed instructions with directions and check-in/check-out procedures.

More about Kuala Lumpur

Kuala Lumpur is the capital of Malaysia and the country's cultural and economic center. Most visitors to the city arrive through Kuala Lumpur International Airport, but the low cost carrier terminal known as Kuala Lumpur International Airport 2 is also a popular entry point for those flying with regional carriers. For those traveling through the city on their way somewhere else, there are plenty of hotels near both airports. However, if staying in Kuala Lumpur, there is plenty of accommodation in the city center as well.

Kuala Lumpur is a very modern city with an efficient and inexpensive public transportation system comprised of trains and light rail. The Petronas Towers are one of the most famous attractions in the city. The connecting bridge between the towers provides spectacular views of the city and taking tours to the sky bridge is a popular activity for tourists. Kuala Lumpur Tower also provides an observation deck featuring 360-degree unobstructed views of the city.

The 'Golden Triangle' section of the city comprises several large malls as shopping is a major attraction in Kuala Lumpur. The main shopping streets are Jalan Bukit Bintang, Jalan Sultan Ismail, and Jalan Imbi.

The city's China Town neighborhood provides a great opportunity to indulge in Chinese and Indian food as the restaurants are inexpensive, authentic, and plentiful. A modern city with a diverse and interesting population, Kuala Lumpur is definitely a place that must be explored.

There’s much more to see and learn about Kuala Lumpur, and the interactive map is a great way to continue uncovering all the important landmarks and attractions of this vibrant city.

The sheets themselves (while undoubtedly cleaned) had multiple ingrained stains all over them and were very poor quality. The main bathroom really stank and the master ensuite was not much better. We left exhaust fans on and sprayed deodoriser but the smell would not budge. The dryer and washing machine filters required cleaning (and servicing according to the dryer readout). You do not have access to the front reception facilities (you need to make a time to meet someone at the property for check in and chec out) and you are only provided with 1 key to your room. More about Kuala Lumpur Kuala Lumpur is the capital of Malaysia and the country's cultural and economic center. Most visitors to the city arrive through Kuala Lumpur International Airport, but the low cost carrier terminal known as Kuala Lumpur International Airport 2 is also a popular entry point for those flying with regional carriers. For those traveling through the city on their way somewhere else, there are plenty of hotels near both airports. However, if staying in Kuala Lumpur, there is plenty of accommodation in the city center as well. Kuala Lumpur is a very modern city with an efficient and inexpensive public transportation system comprised of trains and light rail. The Petronas Towers are one of the most famous attractions in the city. The connecting bridge between the towers provides spectacular views of the city and taking tours to the sky bridge is a popular activity for tourists. Kuala Lumpur Tower also provides an observation deck featuring 360-degree unobstructed views of the city. The 'Golden Triangle' section of the city comprises several large malls as shopping is a major attraction in Kuala Lumpur. The main shopping streets are Jalan Bukit Bintang, Jalan Sultan Ismail, and Jalan Imbi. The city's China Town neighborhood provides a great opportunity to indulge in Chinese and Indian food as the restaurants are inexpensive, authentic, and plentiful. A modern city with a diverse and interesting population, Kuala Lumpur is definitely a place that must be explored. There’s much more to see and learn about Kuala Lumpur, and the interactive map is a great way to continue uncovering all the important landmarks and attractions of this vibrant city.
